channel.title: Wi-Fi Planet Wireless News
channel.description: The Source for Wi-Fi Business and Technology

item.title: Building a Nationwide WISP Collective
item.description: NuTel Broadband wants to help anyone with the desire — and the right location — become a mesh-based broadband provider of Internet and voice service.

item.title: Protecting the Wired from the Wireless
item.description: Network Chemistry's new scanner appliance focuses on rogue detection using Ethernet; company plans quarterly threat report.

item.title: Wi-Fi Product Watch
WiMax Briefs
Nokia Trots Out VoIP, Google For 770 Tablet
item.description: Software upgrade with communication enhancements arrives for Linux-based Wi-Fi device.

item.title: MIMO for the Outdoors
item.description: Newcomer Wavion claims its spatially adaptive equipment will outperform what's currently found in most citywide Wi-Fi.

item.title: Boingo Buys Concourse Network
item.description: The hotspot aggregator becomes a service provider by buying out a company with service in 12 major U.S. aiports.

item.title: Wavesat’s Shark Attack
item.description: The company's new chips are a bridge to mobile WiMax and could be in laptops by next year.

item.title: Hotspot Hits
Boingo Opens Up to Handhelds
item.description: The hotspot aggregator makes its software code for handsets and PDAs available to vendors looking to build in Wi-Fi support.
